intro: Fischeria setosa, commonly known as the hairy Fischeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Fischeria setosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils.
